intro: Phlomoides tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its alpine habitat.
